detailed_results.title: Machine Learning Approaches for Personalized Cancer Treatment

authors.name: Smith J
authors.affiliation: Department of Computer Science, Stanford University, Stanford, CA, USA

authors.name: Johnson R
authors.affiliation: Stanford Cancer Institute, Stanford University, Stanford, CA, USA

authors.name: Williams S
authors.affiliation: Department of Oncology, Mayo Clinic, Rochester, MN, USA

detailed_results.abstract: Personalized cancer treatment requires precise prediction of therapeutic responses. Here we develop machine learning models that integrate genomic, transcriptomic, and clinical data to predict treatment outcomes for various cancer types.

detailed_results.title: Deep Learning for Medical Image Segmentation: A Comprehensive Review

authors.name: Smith J
authors.affiliation: Department of Computer Science, Stanford University, Stanford, CA, USA

authors.name: Davis M
authors.affiliation: Department of Radiology, Stanford University Medical Center, Stanford, CA, USA

detailed_results.abstract: Medical image segmentation is crucial for diagnosis and treatment planning. This comprehensive review examines recent advances in deep learning approaches for medical image segmentation across various imaging modalities.

detailed_results.title: Privacy-Preserving Machine Learning in Healthcare: Federated Learning Approaches

authors.name: Smith J
authors.affiliation: Department of Computer Science, Stanford University, Stanford, CA, USA

authors.name: Brown A
authors.affiliation: Department of Biomedical Informatics, Harvard Medical School, Boston, MA, USA

authors.name: Lee D
authors.affiliation: Department of Computer Science, Stanford University, Stanford, CA, USA

detailed_results.abstract: Healthcare data privacy is paramount in machine learning applications. We present federated learning frameworks that enable collaborative model training while preserving patient privacy across multiple healthcare institutions.

detailed_results.title: Explainable AI in Clinical Decision Support: Interpretable Models for Healthcare

authors.name: Smith J
authors.affiliation: Department of Computer Science, Stanford University, Stanford, CA, USA

authors.name: Wilson S
authors.affiliation: Department of Medicine, Stanford University Medical Center, Stanford, CA, USA

detailed_results.abstract: Clinical decision support systems require transparent and interpretable AI models. We develop explainable machine learning approaches that provide clear reasoning for medical recommendations while maintaining predictive accuracy.
